content: Hi @WG-async-foundations, it's time for our weekly triage meeting!

We have the usual agenda today:

  • Announcements
  • [eholk] New issue triage
  • Discussion on progress/blockers around sprint bugs
Let's start with announcements
@Yoshua Wuyts [he/they] and my change to reland IntoFuture (#90737) was merged last week!
Thanks @tmandry for the review :)
Does anyone else have announcements?
Sounds like not. Let's go ahead and move on.
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Next up is triage. We have two issues, although one I think is left from last week.
The one from last week is "Feature: Provide getters of data and vtable pointer for RawWaker? #87021"
It looks like the libs team is supportive of the idea, so it's ready for someone to put up a PR.
Do we need any more discussion on this issue right now? I'll go ahead and mark it as triaged.
I don't think so
The issue filer was invited to and I don't think it is urgent enough for anyone else to do it
yep, triaged
It seems like a good first issue, so I may keep it around in case someone asks for something to help with.
Okay, next issue: "Duplicate error messages in async code #91463"
I opened this one at @tmandry's request during his code review.
this is an artifact of the .await desugaring, I believe
I thought we had some duplicate issues already
there might be, I don't remember
I don't have anything concrete, but I remember seeing lots of duplicate error messages while I was working on the generator captures.
this definitely pre-existed that PR, fwiw
Ah, okay
the PR added 1-2 copies of the error message, but there were already dupes :p
Ah, makes sense :)
I can't promise I can look at it soon, but I think I have an open pr that might add enough metadata to help deduplicate errors here...
anyway, I'm not sure how urgent it is
(too much output is bad, but never urgent)
I think some of my failed approaches to generator captures fixed a lot of these issues, but maybe this can be fixed with changes to generator_interior.rs?
(too little output that doesn't let people solve their problem is critical)
Actually, I bet why some of my changes fixed it is that sometimes we end up capturing the same type multiple times, even if not all of those instances are actually live.
By not capturing all of those, it lowered the number of errors.

eholk said:

I think some of my failed approaches to generator captures fixed a lot of these issues, but maybe this can be fixed with changes to generator_interior.rs?

if that's where they all get reported
Unfortunately, the version of my change that's actually going to (hopefully) land doesn't fix any of these.
I like @Esteban K端ber's idea of getting some more metadata here.
Anyway, that's probably enough on that issue. I'll write up a couple notes and mark it as triaged after the meeting.

Let's move on.
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
The last item is general discussion about sprint bugs.
Our sprint planning meeting is this Thursday, I believe. I imagine with the holidays (at least in the US), people have been somewhat distracted.
yes, I was going to send out a reminder today. thanks for reminding me :)
before Thanksgiving week I was making slow progress on #74256
I got my PR for the generator captures issue out for review, although I expect it'll need a few rounds of review.

I have a blog post almost ready to kick off the portability and interoperability work. Repo and issues are open, but I'm not sure if that work is complete - there's lots of things in the repo which could be filled in
It's hard to know when to call the repo and such done. I usually just try to do a little bit each sprint and hopefully it will at least stay current.

tmandry said:

before Thanksgiving week I was making slow progress on #74256

I'm having a little trouble understanding the "why" behind all of the various logic in this function (try_report_anon_anon_conflict ), so if anyone is familiar please let me know :)
in particular, this match
I looked at it some, although I don't think I understand the why either. @Gus Wynn might, if I remember right.
anyway, gotta run..
Me too, and we're at time, so let's go ahead and wrap things up.
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Thanks everyone!
